definitions.definition: Jumping , or passing , from one thing or subject to another, without order, planning, or rational connection; lacking logical sequence .
examples: He wandered round, cleaning up in a desultory way.
I teach a class of desultory minds.

definitions.definition: Out of course ; by the way; not connected with the subject.
examples: I made a desultory remark while I was talking to my friend.
She made a desultory attempt at conversation.

definitions.definition: Leaping , skipping or flitting about, generally in a random or unsteady manner.

main_definition: Jumping , or passing , from one thing or subject to another, without order, planning, or rational connection; lacking logical sequence .
secondary_definitions: Out of course ; by the way; not connected with the subject.
( obsolete ) Leaping , skipping or flitting about, generally in a random or unsteady manner.
